revised_title: Chemical Composition and Accretion History of Terrestrial Planets: Insights from the Earth and Mars
tldr: This article discusses the chemical composition of terrestrial planets, focusing on the Earth and Mars. The authors propose an inhomogeneous accretion model for the Earth, involving two components with different chemical compositions. They also analyze the composition of Mars, using SNC meteorites as evidence for its bulk composition. The study highlights the differences in accretion history and composition between the Earth and Mars, providing insights into the formation of these planets.
